name: Kelvin Ward
title: Senior Infrastructure & Automation Engineer
objective: Versatile Technical Lead seeking to drive process automation and operational maturity. Passionate about combining enterprise development (ServiceNow/JS) with modern development practices to solve complex challenges. Looking for a role that values deep technical expertise equally with the ability to mentor talent and build cohesive, high-performing teams
about: Senior Technologist with over 15 years of experience, currently driving value as a Senior ServiceNow Developer. I combine deep-dive engineering expertise (Storage, Linux, DevOps) with a passion for strategic automation. Beyond the stack, I am a people-first leader who thrives on mentoring engineers and helping others ascend their career ladders. I believe that building scalable systems requires building capable teams, and I actively use my management background to foster a culture of technical excellence and collaborative growth.

experience.description: Lead developer for the Customer Service Management (CSM) implementation and internal support tooling. Bridging the gap between complex infrastructure requirements and user-friendly service portals.
highlights: CSM Architecture: Spearheaded the implementation of Customer Service Management modules to streamline support operations.
System Design: Architected custom applications to replace legacy ticketing systems, improving data integrity and agent efficiency.
Full Stack Integration: Built integrations between ServiceNow and external infrastructure monitoring tools using REST APIs and Flow Designer.
Certified System Administrator: Earned the Certified System Administrator (CSA) designation from ServiceNow, demonstrating expertise in system administration and management.

experience.description: Technical lead focused on optimizing the 'Signal to Noise' ratio for system alerts across the entire Pure Storage product portfolio.
highlights: Alert Optimization: Led a strategic initiative to refactor legacy alerting infrastructure, collaborating across engineering teams to deprecate outdated systems.
Cost Reduction: Achieved an estimated $30k/month reduction in operational costs by streamlining alert volume and storage overhead.
Workflow Automation: Created cross-team workflows to standardize alert deployment, significantly reducing manual overhead and configuration errors.

experience.description: Operational leader for a specialized engineering team focused on alerting systems and reliability.
highlights: Team Building: Formed and led a new engineering team dedicated to maintaining and improving the efficacy of alerting systems.
Reliability Engineering: Transitioned from reactive support to proactive Fleet Reliability Engineering, using Python and data analysis to identify systemic issues.
Process Refactoring: Led the initial project to refactor legacy alert definitions, reducing case volume by nearly 50%

experience.description: Founding member of the Utah support center. Progressed from Frontline Support to Escalation Manager, serving as the final technical backstop for critical customer issues.
highlights: Elite Recognition: Inducted into the 'Pure Performers Club' in 2015, an award given to only ~2% of the organization for outstanding impact.
Crisis Management: Managed high-stakes escalations for enterprise customers, troubleshooting complex SAN/NAS interoperability issues.
Mentorship: Served as a technical anchor, training dozens of new engineers on storage protocols (FC, iSCSI) and Linux debugging.

experience.description: Senior technical resource providing expert diagnostics for enterprise storage systems.
highlights: Escalation Duty: Acted as Duty Manager for high-priority incidents, coordinating resources to resolve critical outages.
Protocol Expertise: Mastered enterprise protocols (NFS, CIFS, iSCSI, FC) and mixed-environment troubleshooting (VMware, Windows, Linux).

experience.description: Managed technical support teams for fiber optic services (Verizon FiOS).
highlights: Leadership: Oversaw escalation processes and team performance for both onsite and remote employees.
Service Excellence: Focused on de-escalating difficult customer situations and restoring confidence in service delivery.

certifications: Learning Threat Modeling for Security Professionals
